alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Noble; Payne; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 11:24PM CDT until June 18 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Lincoln County in central Oklahoma... Southeastern Noble County in northern Oklahoma... Eastern Payne County in central Oklahoma... Northeastern Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1124 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Morrison to near Agra to 5 miles north of McLoud, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Cushing, Chandler, Stroud, Prague, Yale, Meeker, Davenport, Morrison, Glencoe, Ripley, Agra, Sparks, Warwick, Kendrick, Quay, Avery, Ingalls, Parkland, and Centerview. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
